title: A Scientific Novel Way of Article and Thesis Writing: Findings from a Survey on Keyword, Sequence, and Importance (KSI) Technique
summary: This paper presents the KSI model as an effective writing technique for graduate students. The model helps in selecting thesis keywords, arranging them in chronological order of significance, and keeping the volume of each keyword according to its importance on the chosen topic. Although machine learning or AI methods are not used in this research, the KSI model has several advantages, including fast problem formulation, comprehensive literature review, rapid publication, good quality thesis, mental stress elimination, and graduation on time.
methodology: The study investigated the effectiveness of the KSI model using a survey of 55 students who participated in a workshop to learn the model. The authors used SPSS statistical tool to analyze the collected data.
research_outcomes: The results showed that attitude and practice had a significant effect on scientific writing performance. The findings implicate that the KSI model is a persuasive writing technique with which supervisors can adequately guide their students.

title: UNNES MOOCs: What strengths does the University have and the society needs?
summary: This paper focuses on designing Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) for Universitas Negeri Semarang (UNNES), incorporating the university's strengths and societal needs. The study uses an explorative design research approach, involving lecturers, students, and policymakers to develop MOOCs as a strategic step in Education 4.0.
methodology: Explorative design research approach with preliminary analysis, focus group discussions, surveys, and online questionnaires
research_outcomes: The study resulted in the development of standard open online course modules, a Learning Management System, and an academic document used as the basis for formulating regulations on MOOCs at UNNES.

title: Using the jigsaw technique to teach patient safety
summary: This paper evaluates the effectiveness of the jigsaw method in teaching principles of diagnostic reasoning to resident trainees. The study compares the jigsaw method to traditional small group learning and finds that the jigsaw method is more effective in promoting collaborative learning and engagement.
methodology: The study used a quasi-experimental design, with participants randomly assigned to either the jigsaw method or traditional small group teaching method. The jigsaw method involved organizing participants into groups and then rearranging them into new groups to share their learning through peer teaching.
research_outcomes: The study found that the jigsaw method was more effective in promoting collaborative learning and engagement, with statistically significant improvement in test scores and higher resident satisfaction compared to traditional small group learning.

title: The Rhetorical Education of Isocrates and the Exemplary in Teaching: Overcoming the “Learnification of Education”
summary: This paper argues that the rhetorical education of Isocrates can serve as an alternative to today's outcome-based education, or 'the learnification of education.' The author analyzes this phenomenon primarily as a crisis of authority, connecting Biesta's critique with Arendt's concept of authority. The paper suggests that educational theory needs to rediscover the roots of the didactical tradition in rhetorics.
methodology: The methodology involves analyzing the rhetorical education of Isocrates and its relevance to today's problems, connecting Biesta's critique with Arendt's concept of authority.
research_outcomes: The paper argues that the learnification of education is a crisis of authority and culture, and suggests that educational theory needs to rediscover the roots of the didactical tradition in rhetorics.

title: Error Analysis of Learning Chinese Detachable Words for Mongolian Students
summary: This paper analyzes the errors made by Mongolian students in using detachable words in Chinese. The study aims to help these students correctly use detachable words and improve their language learning outcomes. Although machine learning or AI methods are not explicitly used in this research, it contributes to the understanding of second-language acquisition and interlanguage theory.
methodology: The paper uses a combination of theoretical research and practical value, collecting data through questionnaires and analyzing results using second language acquisition theory, interlanguage theory, contrastive analysis theory, and error analysis theory.
research_outcomes: The study finds that detachable words are a major difficulty for Mongolian students in learning Chinese. The research provides insights into the errors made by these students and suggests solutions to improve their language learning outcomes.

title: Leadership Competence of Supreme Student Government Officials
summary: This study assesses the leadership competence of University of Bohol Supreme Student Government officials, using a standardized descriptive questionnaire. The research focuses on identifying key leadership competencies and their impact on student government performance.
methodology: The researchers used a standardized descriptive questionnaire as the main instrument in gathering data from target respondents.
research_outcomes: The study found that the highest-rated leadership competencies of UBSSG were Diversity Learning, Self-2 Responsibility, and Integrity; while the lowest-rated leadership competencies were Cross-functional Teamwork, Business Acumen, and Empowerment.

title: Learning Strategies in Elementary Schools During COVID-19 Pandemic in North Sulawesi
summary: This paper explores the experiences of elementary school teachers in implementing learning strategies during the COVID-19 pandemic in North Sulawesi. The study focuses on the psychological impact of physical distancing on teacher-student relations and the adaptation of learning strategies to suit rural and urban conditions.
methodology: Semi-structured interview techniques and narrative content analysis
research_outcomes: The study found that teachers in rural areas were more involved than those in urban areas, and the learning strategy of visiting students directly at home was more dominant in rural areas due to shorter distances. Teachers in urban areas utilized virtual facilities through interactions via smartphones and internet-based applications.

title: Methods of improving the system of motivation of the university teaching staff
summary: This paper examines methods for motivating university teaching staff, focusing on economic and social factors. It proposes a method for calculating incentive payments and discusses the importance of motivation in higher education.
methodology: Information retrieval methods, universal scientific methods, including comparative and factor analysis, detailing, synthesis, generalization
research_outcomes: The paper proposes a method for calculating incentive payments to teaching staff and discusses the importance of motivation in higher education.

title: Smart Wearables for Tennis Game Performance Analysis
summary: This paper presents a miniature wearable device for tracking tennis swings and strokes, which uses machine learning to detect individual hand gestures and monitor biometric data such as skin temperature and pulse rate. The system is designed to support athlete's arm movement tracking and can work in continuous sampling or gesture recognition mode.
methodology: The methodology involves using a miniature wearable device with an IMU that monitors athletes' arm movements, biometric information like pulse rate and skin temperature, and stores the collected data locally on the device. The data can be later downloaded to a PC and transferred to a cloud-based service for visualization.
research_outcomes: The system achieved high accuracy in detecting tennis strokes (90%) and ball speed estimation using a motion sensor. It also demonstrated user-dependent performance with highly accurate results.

title: Effects of Plyometric, Strength and Change of Direction Training on High-School Basketball Player’s Physical Fitness
summary: This study investigates the effects of plyometric, strength, and change of direction training on high-school basketball players' physical fitness. The research focuses on improving performance measures such as vertical jump, sprinting, and flexibility, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The study employed a counterbalanced design with four groups: plyometric training, strength training, change of direction training, and a control group. Participants were randomly assigned to one of the groups and underwent a 7-week training period.
research_outcomes: Significant improvements in physical fitness were observed in all experimental groups compared to the control group, with no significant differences between the three experimental groups.

title: Impacts of gravitational-wave standard siren observations from Einstein Telescope and Cosmic Explorer on weighing neutrinos in interacting dark energy models
summary: This paper investigates the impact of gravitational-wave standard siren observations from Einstein Telescope and Cosmic Explorer on weighing neutrinos in interacting dark energy models. The authors find that these observations can only slightly improve the constraint on the neutrino mass in the IDE models, compared to the current limit.
methodology: The authors use a combination of cosmological observations, including CMB anisotropies, BAO, and SN, to constrain the total neutrino mass. They also consider the impact of GW standard siren observations from ET and CE on these constraints.
research_outcomes: The authors find that the GW standard siren observations can only slightly improve the constraint on the neutrino mass in the IDE models, compared to the current limit. They also discuss the implications of their results for our understanding of neutrino masses and dark energy.

title: Physical Education of Students in the Format of Distance Education
summary: This paper explores the impact of physical education on students during distance learning, particularly in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors suggest that regular physical activity can help maintain and strengthen the health of the younger generation, but do not explicitly mention any machine learning or AI methods used in their research.
methodology: The paper presents a mixed-methods approach combining general theoretical research methods with empirical research methods, including pedagogical experiment, observation, questionnaire, and survey.
statistics: quantitative and qualitative analysis of research results
research_outcomes: The study found that regular physical activity can help maintain and strengthen the health of students during distance learning. The authors also suggest that teachers should continue the educational process within the educational program of the University to support and preserve the health of students.

title: The Effect of Dynamic Geometry Software Geometer's Sketchpad on Students’ Achievement in Topic Circle among Form Two Students
summary: This study investigates the effectiveness of using Geometer's Sketchpad (GSP) in teaching and learning circle properties among Form Two students. The research found that students who used GSP performed better than those who learned traditionally, with significant improvements in understanding and visualizing geometric concepts.
methodology: Quasi-experimental non-equivalent pretest and posttest design study using geometer activities based on GSP software
statistics: Multiple-choice questions covering topics and structure form two circles by topics taught according to the appropriate level with students (easy, medium and hard)
research_outcomes: Students who used GSP showed significant improvements in understanding and visualizing geometric concepts, with positive attitudes towards learning mathematics.

title: Application of computer technology in Aerobics Teaching and training
summary: This paper discusses the application of computer technology in aerobics teaching, highlighting its potential to improve learning outcomes and student engagement. However, the role of ML/AI is minimal as it is not explicitly mentioned or used in the methodology.
methodology: The paper proposes a computer-based aerobics teaching system that utilizes network technology to provide an open learning mode, extensive learning resources, personalized teaching services, and automatic student management.
research_outcomes: The proposed system aims to improve the quality of aerobics education by providing students with more interactive and engaging learning experiences. It also seeks to address issues such as the lack of sports network curriculum resources and the negative impact of exam-oriented education on physical education.

title: Twenty Years’ Development of Teacher Identity Research: A Bibliometric Analysis
summary: This study provides a bibliometric analysis of teacher identity research over the past 20 years, using data from the Web of Science database. The analysis aims to identify the current state and impact of teacher identity research, including research topics, publication patterns, authors, and institutions contributing to this field.
methodology: Bibliometric analysis using the Bibliometrix package in R
research_outcomes: The study found that teacher identity remained a popular research theme over the past 20 years, with many authors, institutions, and sources contributing to this field. The analysis also identified key topics and future research directions.

title: Production-Oriented Approach on ESL Listening and Speaking Teaching in College
summary: This paper explores the production-oriented approach (POA) to teaching English listening and speaking skills in college. The authors investigate whether POA can improve students' achievements in listening and speaking, compared to a traditional re-listening and imitating method. The study finds that POA is effective in improving students' listening and speaking abilities.
methodology: The authors used an experimental design, with two classes of college students as subjects. One class was taught using the production-oriented approach (POA), while the other class was taught using a traditional re-listening and imitating method. The study lasted for 12 weeks, with pre- and post-tests administered to assess students' listening and speaking abilities.
research_outcomes: The results show that POA is effective in improving students' listening and speaking abilities, compared to the traditional method. Students who were taught using POA showed significant improvement in their listening and speaking skills, while those who were taught using the traditional method did not.

title: Challenges of Nursing Students in Relation to Academic Performance at the Faculty of Technical Medical Sciences
summary: This paper explores the challenges faced by nursing students at the Faculty of Technical Medical Sciences in Tirana, Albania. The study uses a qualitative research approach to identify difficulties encountered by students in relation to their academic performance. The findings highlight issues such as low level of student engagement in clinical practice, curriculum structure, educational workload, and organizing the exam season and scheduling.
methodology: qualitative research approach using focus group discussion
research_outcomes: The study identified four categories of challenges faced by nursing students: low level of student engagement in clinical practice, curriculum structure, educational workload, and organizing the exam season and scheduling.

title: SELF-EFFICACY OF JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS IN ONLINE LEARNING
summary: This study examines the self-efficacy of junior high school students in online learning during the COVID-19 pandemic. The research focuses on the dimensions of level, strength, and generality of self-efficacy, using a questionnaire to measure student confidence in completing math tasks. The results show that Indonesian SMP/MTs students have medium levels of self-efficacy in all three dimensions.
methodology: This research is a descriptive study that uses a simple random sampling technique to select participants. A questionnaire was distributed through Google Forms, and the data was analyzed using formulas to calculate the ideal average and standard deviation for each dimension.
research_outcomes: The study found that Indonesian SMP/MTs students have medium levels of self-efficacy in all three dimensions: level (magnitude), strength, and generality. The results suggest that students are confident in completing math tasks but may struggle with more difficult tasks.

title: The Trend of Library Development in Indonesia and the Effects on Literacy Skills in Schools
summary: This study examines the trend of library development in Indonesia from 2017-2021, its significance, and effects on literacy skills. Although machine learning/AI methods are not explicitly used, the study relies on statistical analysis to understand the relationship between libraries and literacy skills.
methodology: Quantitative descriptive, comparison, and correlational analysis using descriptive statistics and repeated measure ANOVA
research_outcomes: The study finds a significant positive relationship between the national average libraries to school ratio and Alibaca Index/Reading Literacy Score, indicating that library presence in schools moderately influences students' literacy skills.

title: Educational or Scientific Career?
summary: This paper explores the dilemma between pedagogical development and research component of teaching in higher educational institutions. The authors conducted interviews with 25 teachers from Chuvash State University to analyze their perception of pedagogical competencies and evaluation of professional development programs.
methodology: Detailed interviews with 25 university professors
research_outcomes: The study found that 35% of teachers do not know if the University HR department does career planning for them, while 53% believe it is not involved.

title: Covid-19 Pandemic: Difficulties Faced By Special Education Teachers During Emergency Remote Teaching Through Online Learning And Their Opinions
summary: This paper explores the difficulties faced by special education teachers during emergency remote teaching through online learning to special needs students and their opinions during Covid-19 pandemic. The study found that teachers play a vital role in making the online educational system successful, but they face several challenges, including lack of communication due to limitations of video calling, electricity issues, and parents' unresponsiveness.
methodology: The study used a descriptive research design with a survey method to collect data from special education teachers who were teaching special needs students at government special education institutions in Faisalabad division of Punjab province Pakistan.
research_outcomes: The study found that teachers face several challenges during emergency remote teaching, including lack of communication, electricity issues, and parents' unresponsiveness. However, they also reported positive outcomes, such as students' excellent performance in online classes.

title: The Use of Asynchronous Google Classroom with Video Teaching Tutorial on Improving Student Writing Achievement for Recount Text at Public Senior High School Kendari
summary: This study investigates the effectiveness of asynchronous Google Classroom with video teaching tutorial on improving students' writing achievement for recount text at SMAN 6 Kendari. The research uses a pre-experimental one-group pre-test and post-test design, collecting data through written tests analyzed using paired sample t-tests. The results show a significant difference in gain scores between pre- and post-tests, indicating a positive effect of asynchronous Google Classroom with video teaching tutorial on student writing achievement.
methodology: Pre-experimental one-group pre-test and post-test design
research_outcomes: Significant difference in gain scores between pre- and post-tests, indicating a positive effect of asynchronous Google Classroom with video teaching tutorial on student writing achievement.

title: Consequences of Patellar Tendinopathy on Isokinetic Knee Strength and Jumps in Professional Volleyball Players
summary: This study evaluates the impact of patellar tendinopathy (PT) on isokinetic knee strength and jump performances in professional volleyball players. The results show that PT has a significant effect on knee extensor strength, with both symptomatic and asymptomatic legs showing decreased values compared to healthy legs.
methodology: The study used isokinetic dynamometry to assess knee concentric isokinetic strength in professional volleyball players with and without PT. The participants performed single-leg countermovement jumps and one leg hop tests, and their symptoms and sportive activities were assessed using the Victorian Institute of Sport Assessment-Patella (VISA-P) score.
research_outcomes: The study found that PT has a significant effect on knee extensor strength, with both symptomatic and asymptomatic legs showing decreased values compared to healthy legs. The results also show that jump evaluation and isokinetic testing are appropriate methods for assessing the functional impact of PT.

title: E-learning: An effective mode of teaching English as a Second Language
summary: This paper explores the effectiveness of e-learning in teaching English as a second language, highlighting its benefits and tools. Although ML/AI methods are not explicitly used, the study focuses on computer-based technologies and online learning platforms to enhance language skills.
methodology: The study is analytical, based on secondary sources like research journals, online sources, and scholarly articles, with classroom observation. E-learning tools such as internet, Google Classroom, Google Meet, WhatsApp, podcasts, vodcasts, blogger.com, and YouTube were used.
research_outcomes: The study found that e-learning can effectively enhance language skills, vocabulary development, and grammar acquisition in English as a second language. E-learning tools improve the efficiency of teaching and learning situations.

title: A Systematic Review: The Effect of Culturally Responsive Pedagogy on Student Learning and Achievement
summary: This systematic review examines the effect of Culturally Responsive Pedagogy on student learning and academic achievement. The study finds that this pedagogy has a positive impact on students' involvement in learning and academic achievement, but notes that research on its effectiveness is still limited.
methodology: The PRISMA Protocol was used to select relevant articles, with a search process using the ERIC and Google Scholar databases.
research_outcomes: The study found that Culturally Responsive Pedagogy has a positive impact on students' academic learning and achievement, increasing student involvement in learning and improving academic achievement.
